title: Product Manager, Tax Filing
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Collecting and filing sales & indirect taxes is a classic area for technology disruption. Companies selling across countries, states, and even smaller jurisdictions have to navigate through a myriad of tax rates, product-level tax exemptions, filing requirements, and registration obligations. The rules are constantly changing, and not accurately calculating and filing tax can have legal ramifications.  
It’s no surprise then that solving for tax compliance is a top customer ask. We launched Stripe Tax as a new SaaS product in 2021 to help solve this pain-point and make tax compliance as effortless as possible. It’s still early days, and we’re looking for strong product managers to help shape our product and build our business. 
 
What you’ll do
Responsibilities
As a Product Manager on the new Stripe Tax Filing team, you’ll develop and bring to market a new product for Stripe. You will create intuitive user-facing experiences to solve a complex user problem. You’ll go deep into user needs, and build a product we can offer to direct Stripe users and help platforms embed in their offering. You’ll also own key business metrics, and lead a team of strong engineering, design, product marketing, and data science partners to drive product adoption and growth.
Our ideal Product Manager has an uncommonly discerning design sense while also being deeply analytical; they pair the two skills to find opportunities to power Stripe Tax’s growth while delighting our users. They are known to make things happen quickly, and are influential across product teams.
 
Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

7+ years of product management experience, especially on driving adoption of user-facing products. You have experience managing technical software products from kick-off to ship
An uncommonly discerning design sense
Strong analytical skills. You can look at a problem, structure it, and quickly decide where to focus the team
A demonstrated ability to influence other product and cross-functional teams
Persistence and a whatever-it-takes approach to ensure that your product is successful
Strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems

Preferred qualifications

Software engineering experience, a computer science or engineering degree, or similar technical experience

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
